Row.Text: [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"They that are discontented under monarchy, call it tyranny; and they which find themselves grieved under a democracy, call it anarchy, which signifies the want of government; and yet I think no man believes, that want of government, is any new kind of government."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Thomas Hobbes[NEWLINE][TAB]

Governments and Political Reforms represent the way that you choose to rule over your people. Will you be an authoritarian ruler, sacrificing a little freedom for discipline and increased productivity? Will you cultivate a totalized state or will you foster a diverse civil society? Will you have a kingdom, or a republic?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Political Reforms impact your civilization in diverse ways, granting bonuses in exchange for penalties. Some may increase your civilization's culture whilst reducing its gold, whilst others might enhance your military whilst leaving your cities vulnerable. Reforms are decided to suit your needs at any given time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]For more information, see the Sovereignty article in the Concepts tab.

Replace.Text: Social Policies represent the inherent values of your society and its people. Do you cultivate your people's traditions or do you hone their civic virtues? Will you organize your civilization to have a strong military, or will you concentrate their efforts on expanding culture?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Social policies have concrete effects in play. Some may increase your cities' production, while others might generate more wealth, and still others might create more effective military units. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]There are no right or wrong social policy choices in the game. One policy may be better for a given circumstance than another (say, if you're surrounded by belligerent civs you may want to take a different path than if you're relatively isolated), and one may better suit your play style. Try them out and see.

Row.Text: [ICON_BULLET]Loses 1 [ICON_JFD_VIRTUE] Virtue per 2 Capital Population.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Generates [ICON_JFD_VIRTUE] Virtue from unlocking Technologies.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Becomes Oligarchy after [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1% per Capital Population to all [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Yield Rates: [ICON_RESEARCH] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]125%[ENDCOLOR], [ICON_GOLD] [COLOR_POSITIVE_FADING_TEXT]100%[ENDCOLOR], [ICON_CULTURE] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]75%[ENDCOLOR]

[ICON_BULLET]Loses 1 [ICON_JFD_VIRTUE] Virtue per City.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Generates [ICON_JFD_VIRTUE] Virtue from adopting Social Policies.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Becomes Autocracy after [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+0.25% per Population to all [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Yield Rates: [ICON_CULTURE] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]125%[ENDCOLOR], [ICON_RESEARCH] [COLOR_POSITIVE_FADING_TEXT]100%[ENDCOLOR], [ICON_GOLD][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]75%[ENDCOLOR]

[ICON_BULLET]Loses 1 [ICON_JFD_VIRTUE] Virtue per 10 Population.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Generates [ICON_JFD_VIRTUE] Virtue from constructing Buildings.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Becomes Democracy after [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+5% per City to all [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Yield Rates: [ICON_GOLD] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]125%[ENDCOLOR], [ICON_CULTURE] [COLOR_POSITIVE_FADING_TEXT]100%[ENDCOLOR], [ICON_RESEARCH] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]75%[ENDCOLOR]

[ICON_BULLET]Loses 1 [ICON_JFD_VIRTUE] Virtue per City NOT following your Religion.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Reverts to your previous Power after [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+0.5% per Global Cities following your Religion to all [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Generates [ICON_JFD_VIRTUE] Virtue from spending Faith.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Yield Rates: [ICON_PEACE] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]125%[ENDCOLOR], [ICON_RESEARCH] [COLOR_POSITIVE_FADING_TEXT]100%[ENDCOLOR], [ICON_GOLD] [COLOR_POSITIVE_FADING_TEXT]100%[ENDCOLOR], [ICON_CULTURE] [COLOR_POSITIVE_FADING_TEXT]100%[ENDCOLOR]

A Government allows you to pass [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Political Reforms, which provide certain bonuses in exchange for penalties. Reforms need [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty to pass, and the Government you choose can affect how much is needed based on the Factions they possess.
Choose one of the following Governments:
You can change to one of the following Governments:
Are you sure you want to adopt [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_GovtName}[ENDCOLOR] as your civilization's Government?
Are you sure you want to adopt [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_GovtName}[ENDCOLOR] as your civilization's new Government?

Are you sure you want to adopt [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_GovtName}[ENDCOLOR] as your civilization's new Government? [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Doing so will incur [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy for {2_Num} Turn(s).[ENDCOLOR]

Are you sure you want to adopt [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_GovtName}[ENDCOLOR] as your civilization's new Government? [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Doing so will end your current period of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Changing to this Government will incur 1 Turn of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established if you have established a {1_Description}.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when all your cities are connected to the Capital and you have at least 2 of them.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when all your cities have a Military Garrison.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when you are at war with a major Civilization.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when you are in a state of Anarchy.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when you are NOT in a state of Anarchy.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established from the beginning of the {1_Desc}.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when you have built the {1_Desc} Wonder.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when you have built a {1_Desc} in all cities.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when you have at least {1_Num} City-State Allies.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when you have at least {1_Num} active Trade Routes.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when you control at least one former Capital.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when you are in a Golden Age.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established if you have adopted an Ideology.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when you have an improved source of Horses.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when you have a Great General.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established if you have not founded a Religion but are following a foreign Religion.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established if you have founded a Religion.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when you have enhanced your Religion.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when all cities following your main Religion are under your control.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when some cities following your main Religion are not under your control.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established with a Global Population of {1_Num} (you have {2_Num}).[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when you have researched the {1_Desc} Tech.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when no other Civilization claims it. {1_Desc} is currently claiming it.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_FADING_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Government can only be established when no other Civilization claims this Government. You are currently claiming it.[ENDCOLOR]

Each Government has its own Legislature.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Factions that compose your Legislature will influence your ability to pass [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Political Reforms based upon their [ICON_JFD_FACTION_POWER] Faction Power; making it easier to pass Reforms that they support and harder to pass ones that they oppose.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Factions belonging to [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR]:

You can appoint this Great Person to your Council as your [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Council seats can be filled by one or more different types of Great Person, each conferring a different bonus to your Reform costs. Only one Great Person can occupy a Council seat at a time and only Great People that have been earned naturally.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You cannot appoint this Great Person to your Council because you have not yet established a formal Government.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You currently have a Councillor acting as {1_Desc}. If you choose to appoint this Great Person to your Council, the existing Councillor will be replaced.[ENDCOLOR]
Are you sure you want to appoint {1_Desc} as your [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Desc}[ENDCOLOR]?
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This Council seat is currently occupied by {1_Desc}. Are you sure you want to replace them and appoint this {3_Desc} as your new [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{4_Desc}[ENDCOLOR]?[ENDCOLOR]
Reforms may not be passed until you have established a Government. This choice becomes available after you research Code of Laws.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You are in [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy for {1_Num} Turn(s)! Whilst in Anarchy, you cannot pass Political Reforms.[ENDCOLOR]
You can choose to change your Government at the cost of incurring [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy or for free if Anarchy is currently on-going.
This is the amount by which this Faction will influence the [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty needed to pass a Reform that they support or oppose.

This is the amount by which this Faction will influence the [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty needed to pass a Reform that they support or oppose.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your cities voted as follows:[NEWLINE]
Reforms marked with this icon were unlocked this Era.
You can pass {1_Num} Reforms without increasing the [ICON_JFD_REFORM_COOLDOWN] Cooldown afterwards.
These Reforms will not incur a Cooldown when passed.
Are you sure you want to pass [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] ({2_Desc})? You cannot revert this Reform for {3_Num} Turns.

Are you sure you want to pass [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] ({2_Desc})? You cannot revert this Reform for {3_Num} Turns.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]As you are AT your Reform Capacity, passing this Reform will immediately reduce your current [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty by {4_Num}%![ENDCOLOR]

Are you sure you want to pass the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] ({2_Desc}) Reform? You will be unable to revert this Reform for {3_Num} Turns.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]As you are OVER your Reform Capacity, passing this Reform will immediately reduce your current [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty by a further {4_Num}%![ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Because one of your Factions opposes this Reform, there is a {1_Num}% chance that trying to pass it will incite [ICON_JFD_FACTION_REVOLUTIONARIES] Revolutionaries to take power, triggering a turn of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy![ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Because one of your Factions opposes this Reform, passing it will increase your [ICON_JFD_REVOLUTIONARY_SENTIMENT] Revolutionary Sentiment, which in turn could incite [ICON_JFD_FACTION_REVOLUTIONARIES] Revolutionaries to take power and trigger a turn of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy![ENDCOLOR]

[ICON_JFD_REVOLUTIONARY_SENTIMENT] Revolutionary Sentiment determines the chance of the [ICON_JFD_FACTION_REVOLUTIONARIES] [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Revolutionaries Faction[ENDCOLOR] coming into power whenever you pass a Reform that one of your Factions oppose. If this happens, [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy will break out and the [ICON_JFD_FACTION_REVOLUTIONARIES] Revolutionaries will occupy your Legislature until it ends.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Total [ICON_JFD_REVOLUTIONARY_SENTIMENT] Revolutionary Sentiment: [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]You are below your Reform Capacity.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You can pass as many Left/Right Reforms as your Reform Capacity allows. Reforms over your Capacity will reduce your [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty by 10% each.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Increase your Capacity by advancing Era.

You have reached your Reform Capacity.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You have passed as many Left/Right Reforms as your Reform Capacity allows. Further Reforms will reduce your [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty by 10% each.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Increase your Capacity by advancing Era.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You are over your Reform Capacity![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You have passed more Left/Right Reforms than your Reform Capacity allows, reducing your [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty by 10% each.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Increase your Capacity by advancing Era.
The [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] {1: plural 1?is; 2?are;} your dominant Faction. They impact the [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty requirements of your Reforms the most.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Revolutionaries[ENDCOLOR] have taken over your Legislature for the duration of this period of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy! Your Government cannot operate until it ends.
Turns until your current Legislature is dissolved and a new one re-composed: [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] Turn(s)

When your [ICON_JFD_GOVERNMENT_COOLDOWN] Legislature Cooldown ends, your Legislature will be reset and the power of your Factions will be re-assessed. The power of each Faction will have direct impact upon the [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty needed to pass certain Reforms, based upon those Reforms that they support and those that they oppose.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Hover over the Factions that make up your Legislature for the specific conditions that determine their power.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You must establish an Embassy with this Leader in order to see their Reforms.[ENDCOLOR]
You can choose to establish a Government.

A new [ICON_JFD_LEGISLATURE] Legislature has been formed![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Factions that compose your Legislature will influence your ability to pass [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Political Reforms based upon their share of [ICON_JFD_FACTION_POWER] Power; making it easier to pass Reforms that they support and harder to pass ones that they oppose.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Results are as follows:
[ICON_JFD_FACTION_REVOLUTIONARIES] Revolutionaries have overthrown your Legislature, triggering a turn of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy! Your Government will be unable to operate until it ends.
You can choose to establish a Government.
You have appointed [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Desc} the {2_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] to your Council as your new [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_Desc}[ENDCOLOR].
You have established a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] as your civilization's Government.
You have established a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] as your civilization's new Government, replacing your old system of [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]{2_Desc}[ENDCOLOR].
You have established the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] as your civilization's Government.
You have established the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] as your civilization's new Government, replacing your old system of [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]{3_Desc}[ENDCOLOR].
Your Legislature Cooldown is about to end in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] turn(s). After this time, your Legislature will be dissolved and a new one will be formed.

A new [ICON_JFD_LEGISLATURE] Legislature has been formed under the leadership of the [COLOR_JFD_FACTION_POWER]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR]![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Factions that make up your Legislature will influence your ability to pass [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Political Reforms based upon their [ICON_JFD_FACTION_POWER] Faction Power.
You have claimed the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mandate of Heaven[ENDCOLOR]!
You have lost the [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Mandate of Heaven[ENDCOLOR], triggering [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy for {1_Num} Turn(s)!
A New Era Begins! The following Reforms are now available:{1_List}
Your Reform Capacity has expanded! You can now pass additional Reforms without it affecting your Sovereignty.

You have passed a new {1_ReformBranchCategory} Reform favouring [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_ReformDesc}[ENDCOLOR] ({3_ReformCategory})![NEWLINE]----------[NEWLINE]{4_ReformPedia}[NEWLINE]----------[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Bonuses:[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]----------[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{5_ReformBonusHelp}[NEWLINE]----------[NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Penalties:[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]----------[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{6_ReformPenaltyHelp}[NEWLINE]----------
A Reform cooldown period has just ended and your [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty has been re-assessed. New Reforms may now be passed if you meet their requirements.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] have taken power over your Government, triggering [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy for {2_Num} Turn(s)! During this time, your Government will be unable to operate.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] have lost power over your Government, bringing an end to your period of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy!
{1_CivName} {1: plural 1?has; 2?have;} established a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] as their civilization's Government.

{1_CivName} {1: plural 1?has; 2?have;} established a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] as their civilization's new Government, replacing their old system of [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]{3_Desc}[ENDCOLOR].
{1_CivName} {1: plural 1?has; 2?have;} established the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] as their civilization's Government.

{1_CivName} {1: plural 1?has; 2?have;} established the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] as their civilization's new Government, replacing their old system of [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]{3_Desc}[ENDCOLOR].
The [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] {1: plural 1?has; 2?have;} taken power in the {2_Desc} Government!
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]{1_Desc}[ENDCOLOR] {1: plural 1?has; 2?have;} taken power over the {2_Desc} Government!
Protests over Political Reforms have broken out in the {1_CivName}.
{1_TextHighlight}{2_Num}%[ENDCOLOR] when you have [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_Num} or less[ENDCOLOR] cities.
{1_TextHighlight}{2_Num}%[ENDCOLOR] when you have [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_Num} or more[ENDCOLOR] cities.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]{1_Num}% to all [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY][ENDCOLOR] from exceeding Reform Capacity[ENDCOLOR].
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}% to all [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY][ENDCOLOR] from Mandate of Heaven[ENDCOLOR].
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You cannot pass Reforms whilst your civilization is in [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You must wait {1_Num} Turn(s) to pass another Reform from within this group.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This Reform is incompatible with your current Government.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You cannot pass this Reform right now.[ENDCOLOR]
Current Legislature Cooldown: [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] Turn(s)[NEWLINE]Cooldown after next Legislature: [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR] Turn(s).
[ICON_JFD_LEGISLATURE_COOLDOWN] Legislature Cooldown only occurs at the beginning of each new Era.
Current Reform Cooldown: [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] Turn(s)[NEWLINE][ENWLINE]Cooldown after passing a Reform: [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR] Turn(s).

Your [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty is: {4_HL}{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR]/[COLOR_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY]{2_Num}%[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Next Turn, your [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty is projected to be: {5_HL}{3_Num}[ENDCOLOR]/[COLOR_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY]{2_Num}%[ENDCOLOR]

Replace.Text: [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Your Civlization is in [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy for {1_Turns} more turn(s). During [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy, you will be unable to pass [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Political Reforms.[ENDCOLOR]
